CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 7, 1953, pg. 2 reads: " 'Held for Federal Court - Alleged "pushers" and "junkies" nabbed during the recent Hill District narcotics dragnet found the going quite rough before United States Commissioner Harold Lavine last week and this week as they appeared before him on charges of having sold "junk" to Federal undercover agents. The agents' testimony included time, place, amount of dope and identification of the "pushers."  After discovering who one of the undercover agents was, some of the suspects plead guilty.  The rest were held for court on the basis of the damaging testimony and heavy bonds were imposed...Next, Jane DePofi, with her mother, Mrs. Ruth DePofi, who was not a suspect for arraignment at this hearing, denied ever having sold dope to an undercover agent but was held for court nevertheless under $5,000 bond....-Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Jane DePofi wearing eyeglasses, seated between Atty. Albert "Al" Martin and mother Ruth DePofi, awaiting arraignment on narcotics charges in Pittsburgh Federal Courthouse
